do you have sound with ``aplay /usr/share/sounds/startup.wav''?
so kill whatever's using the audio device.  ``lsof /dev/dsp* /dev/snd/*''
(to get a list of processes)
that's easy. bittornado is hogging the oss emulation device /dev/dsp, which is exclusive. If an app opens /dev/dsp, no other app can if your hardware doesn't natively support pcm multiplexing.
so close bittornado.
what device does youtube use?
so close bittornado and restart youtube or whatever.
what's the status?

#1. ``sudo apt-get --purge remove flashplugin-nonfree''  #2. Download the install.tar.gz from Macromedia's/Adobe's Web site (follow the Download> Players links)  #3. ``sudo apt-get --reinstall install flashplugin-nonfree'' but choose NO when prompted to download from the Internet
#4. ``sudo update-flashplugin --local-file $dir_containing_the_install.tar.gz''
pay attention to step #4: it's the /directory/ not the path to the install.tar.gz
the install tar is on the desktop
did you use step #4 that I gave you above?
